headline: Bilt CEO says your rent isn't building your future
summary: Opening Bid Unfiltered is available on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, YouTube, or wherever you get your podcasts. Bilt is entering its next chapter. As the payments and rewards platform for over 70% of the top rental companies nationwide, Bilt is now eyeing several new product launches to kick off 2026. One of them includes ‘Bilt Cash'. The company is armed with $250 million in fresh funding from investors to pursue its ambitions, which valued the company at $10.75 billion. Former American Express (AXP) CEO Ken Chenault remains on the board, and one of the newer additions was NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell who was named on January 24, 2024. Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi sits down on the Opening Bid Unfiltered podcast with Bilt founder and CEO Ankur Jain to discuss what’s next for the privately held company that counts General Catalyst as a top investor. Jain also peels back the layers on his entrepreneurial journey. Listen on your favorite podcast platform or watch on our website for full episodes of Opening Bid Unfiltered. Yahoo Finance's Opening Bid Unfiltered is produced by Langston Sessoms.

Listen on your favorite podcast platform or watch on our website for full episodes of Opening Bid Unfiltered.

headline: US Financial 15 Split Corp. Preferred Dividend Declared
summary: TORONTO, Jan. 20, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- US Financial 15 Split Corp ("US Financial 15") declares its monthly distribution of $0.07283 for each Preferred share, or 10.00% annually based on the previous month end net asset value. Distributions are payable February 10, 2026 to shareholders on record as at January 30, 2026. US Financial 15 invests in a portfolio consisting of 15 U.S. financial services companies as follows:American Express, Bank of America, Bank of New York Mellon Corp., Citigroup

content.title: US Financial 15 Split Corp. Preferred Dividend Declared
content.summary: TORONTO, Jan. 20, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- US Financial 15 Split Corp ("US Financial 15") declares its monthly distribution of $0.07283 for each Preferred share, or 10.00% annually based on the previous month end net asset value. Distributions are payable February 10, 2026 to shareholders on record as at January 30, 2026. US Financial 15 invests in a portfolio consisting of 15 U.S. financial services companies as follows:American Express, Bank of America, Bank of New York Mellon Corp., Citigroup

headline: American Express Declares Dividend on Series D Preferred Stock
summary: NEW YORK, January 20, 2026--The Board of Directors of American Express Company (NYSE: AXP) declared a quarterly dividend on the company’s 3.550% Fixed Rate Reset Noncumulative Preferred Shares, Series D, of $8,875.00 per share (which is equivalent to $8.87500 per related Depositary Share).

content.title: American Express Declares Dividend on Series D Preferred Stock
content.summary: NEW YORK, January 20, 2026--The Board of Directors of American Express Company (NYSE: AXP) declared a quarterly dividend on the company’s 3.550% Fixed Rate Reset Noncumulative Preferred Shares, Series D, of $8,875.00 per share (which is equivalent to $8.87500 per related Depositary Share).

headline: How AI turns your home into a hotel-like experience
summary: Opening Bid Unfiltered is available on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, YouTube, or wherever you get your podcasts. What if your apartment worked like a five-star hotel? On this episode of Opening Bid Unfiltered, Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi sits down with Bilt founder Ankur Jain to unpack how AI is reshaping life at home—from concierge-style maintenance to neighborhood rewards and seamless local commerce. Jain explains why Bilt is positioning itself as a customer experience platform, not a bank or credit card company, and why traditional players like American Express (AXP) and PayPal (PYPL) have missed this opportunity. The conversation offers a forward-looking look at how AI could redefine housing, loyalty, and everyday spending. Listen on your favorite podcast platform or watch on our website for full episodes of Opening Bid Unfiltered. This post was written by Langston Sessoms, producer for Opening Bid Unfiltered.
